abstract.p: Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center in Nyack, NY, will celebrate namesake's 100th birthday with benefit gala at actress's former estate, Pretty Penny, in Nyack; photo (M)

block.p: THE Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center in Nyack will celebrate the 100th birthday of its namesake with wine, women, men and song next Sunday. James MacArthur, the son of the actress and of the playwright Charles MacArthur, will be master of ceremonies for the evening.

THE Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center in Nyack will celebrate the 100th birthday of its namesake with wine, women, men and song next Sunday. James MacArthur, the son of the actress and of the playwright Charles MacArthur, will be master of ceremonies for the evening.
The festivities, a benefit for the arts center, start with a 4 p.m. cocktail party at the actress's former estate, Pretty Penny in Nyack, courtesy of its current owners, Ed Kopko and Cindy Jorbel.

The party will shift to the performing arts center in time for a 7 p.m. tribute to Miss Hayes. Zoe Caldwell, Charles Durning, Tovah Feldshuh, Julie Harris, William Hurt, Donna Murphy, David Shire, Elaine Stritch and members of the cast of the Broadway musical ''Swing'' are among the guests who will perform. Film clips, slides and audio clips of Miss Hayes's stage, film and radio performances will round out the entertainment.
The evening ends with a champagne and dessert reception at the Nyack Seaport.
Tickets are $150 for the performance and champagne reception, $100 for the performance only. (The cocktail party is sold out). Information: (845) 358-6333.
